{"step_by_step_thinking": "Idiopathic cholestasis of pregnancy, also known as intrahepatic cholestasis of pregnancy, is a liver disorder that occurs in pregnant women. It is characterized by pruritus and elevated serum bile acids, with or without abnormal liver function tests. The main features include pruritus, elevated serum bile acids, and abnormal liver function tests such as elevated serum bilirubin, alkaline phosphatase, and aminotransferases (AST and ALT). However, it does not typically cause a prolongation of prothrombin time as this is more associated with severe liver disease or vitamin K deficiency.", "answer_choice": "D"}
